groupItems.js

Summary
groupItems.js
GroupItemA single groupItem in the TabView window.
Functions
GroupItem
Variables
_activeTabThe TabItem for the groupItem’s active tab.
defaultNameThe prompt text for the title field.
Functions
setActiveTabSets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.
getActiveTabGets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.
getStorageDataReturns all of the info worth storing about this groupItem.
isEmptyReturns true if the tab groupItem is empty and unnamed.
saveSaves this groupItem to persistent storage.
deleteDataDeletes the groupItem in the persistent storage.
getTitleReturns the title of this groupItem as a string.
setTitleSets the title of this groupItem with the given string
adjustTitleSizeUsed to adjust the width of the title box depending on groupItem width and title size.
getContentBoundsReturns a <Rect> for the groupItem’s content area (which doesn’t include the title, etc).
setBoundsSets the bounds with the given <Rect>, animating unless “immediately” is false.
setZSet the Z order for the groupItem’s container, as well as its children.
closeCloses the groupItem, removing (but not closing) all of its children.
closeAllCloses the groupItem and all of its children.
_unhideShows the hidden group.
closeHiddenRemoves the group item, its children and its container.
_fadeAwayUndoButtonFades away the undo button
_createUndoButtonMakes the affordance for undo a close group action
addAdds an item to the groupItem.
removeRemoves an item from the groupItem.
removeAllRemoves all of the groupItem’s children.
hideExpandControlHide the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.
showExpandControlShow the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.
shouldStackReturns true if the groupItem should stack (instead of grid).
arrangeLays out all of the children.
_stackArrangeArranges the children in a stack.
_randRotateRandom rotation generator for _stackArrange
childHitCalled by one of the groupItem’s children when the child is clicked on.
collapseCollapses the groupItem from the expanded “tray” mode.
_addHandlersHelper routine for the constructor; adds various event handlers to the container.
setResizableSets whether the groupItem is resizable and updates the UI accordingly.
newTabCreates a new tab within this groupItem.
reorderTabItemsBasedOnTabOrderReorders the tabs in a groupItem based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the tab bar.
reorderTabsBasedOnTabItemOrderReorders the tabs in the tab bar based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the groupItem.
setTopChildSets the Item that should be displayed on top when in stack mode.
getChildReturns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.
getChildrenReturns all children.
GroupItemsSingelton for managing all GroupItems.
Functions
init
uninit
pauseArrangeBypass arrange() calls and collect for resolution in resumeArrange()
pushArrangePush an arrange() call and its arguments onto an array to be resolved in resumeArrange()
resumeArrangeResolve bypassed and collected arrange() calls
_handleAttrModifiedwatch for icon changes on app tabs
addAppTabAdds the given xul:tab to the app tab tray in all groups
removeAppTabRemoves the given xul:tab from the app tab tray in all groups
getNextIDReturns the next unused groupItem ID.
getStorageDataReturns an object for saving GroupItems state to persistent storage.
saveAllSaves GroupItems state, as well as the state of all of the groupItems.
_saveSaves GroupItems state.
getBoundingBoxGiven an array of DOM elements, returns a <Rect> with (roughly) the union of their locations.
reconstituteRestores to stored state, creating groupItems as needed.
loadLoads the storage data for groups.
groupItemStorageSanityGiven persistent storage data for a groupItem, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.
registerAdds the given GroupItem to the list of groupItems we’re tracking.
unregisterRemoves the given GroupItem from the list of groupItems we’re tracking.
groupItemGiven some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate groupItem.
removeAllRemoves all tabs from all groupItems (which automatically closes all unnamed groupItems).
newTabGiven a TabItem, files it in the appropriate groupItem.
getActiveGroupItemReturns the active groupItem.
setActiveGroupItemSets the active groupItem, thereby showing only the relevant tabs and setting the groupItem which will receive new tabs.
getActiveOrphanTabReturns the active orphan tab, in cases when there is no active groupItem.
setActiveOrphanTabIn cases where an orphan tab (not in a groupItem) is active by itself, this function is called and the “active orphan tab” is set.
_updateTabBarHides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active groupItem or currently active orphan tabItem
updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBarSets active TabItem and GroupItem, and updates tab bar appropriately.
getOrphanedTabsReturns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a groupItem.
getNextGroupItemTab
moveTabToGroupItemUsed for the right click menu in the tab strip; moves the given tab into the given group.
killNewTabGroupRemoves the New Tab Group, which is now defunct.
removeHiddenGroupsRemoves all hidden groups’ data and its browser tabs.
enforceMinSizeTakes a <Rect> and modifies that <Rect> in case it is too small to be the bounds of a GroupItem.
getUnclosableGroupItemIdIf there’s only one (non-hidden) group, and there are app tabs present, returns that group.
updateGroupCloseButtonsUpdates group close buttons.

GroupItem

A single groupItem in the TabView window.  Descended from Item.  Note that it implements the <Subscribable> interface.

Summary
Functions
GroupItem
Variables
_activeTabThe TabItem for the groupItem’s active tab.
defaultNameThe prompt text for the title field.
Functions
setActiveTabSets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.
getActiveTabGets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.
getStorageDataReturns all of the info worth storing about this groupItem.
isEmptyReturns true if the tab groupItem is empty and unnamed.
saveSaves this groupItem to persistent storage.
deleteDataDeletes the groupItem in the persistent storage.
getTitleReturns the title of this groupItem as a string.
setTitleSets the title of this groupItem with the given string
adjustTitleSizeUsed to adjust the width of the title box depending on groupItem width and title size.
getContentBoundsReturns a <Rect> for the groupItem’s content area (which doesn’t include the title, etc).
setBoundsSets the bounds with the given <Rect>, animating unless “immediately” is false.
setZSet the Z order for the groupItem’s container, as well as its children.
closeCloses the groupItem, removing (but not closing) all of its children.
closeAllCloses the groupItem and all of its children.
_unhideShows the hidden group.
closeHiddenRemoves the group item, its children and its container.
_fadeAwayUndoButtonFades away the undo button
_createUndoButtonMakes the affordance for undo a close group action
addAdds an item to the groupItem.
removeRemoves an item from the groupItem.
removeAllRemoves all of the groupItem’s children.
hideExpandControlHide the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.
showExpandControlShow the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.
shouldStackReturns true if the groupItem should stack (instead of grid).
arrangeLays out all of the children.
_stackArrangeArranges the children in a stack.
_randRotateRandom rotation generator for _stackArrange
childHitCalled by one of the groupItem’s children when the child is clicked on.
collapseCollapses the groupItem from the expanded “tray” mode.
_addHandlersHelper routine for the constructor; adds various event handlers to the container.
setResizableSets whether the groupItem is resizable and updates the UI accordingly.
newTabCreates a new tab within this groupItem.
reorderTabItemsBasedOnTabOrderReorders the tabs in a groupItem based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the tab bar.
reorderTabsBasedOnTabItemOrderReorders the tabs in the tab bar based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the groupItem.
setTopChildSets the Item that should be displayed on top when in stack mode.
getChildReturns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.
getChildrenReturns all children.

Functions

GroupItem

function GroupItem(listOfEls,
options)

Parameters

listOfElsan array of DOM elements for tabs to be added to this groupItem
optionsvarious options for this groupItem (see below).  In addition, gets passed to add along with the elements provided.

Possible options

idspecifies the groupItem’s id; otherwise automatically generated
lockedsee Item.locked; default is {}
userSizesee Item.userSize; default is null
boundsa <Rect>; otherwise based on the locations of the provided elements
containera DOM element to use as the container for this groupItem; otherwise will create
titlethe title for the groupItem; otherwise blank
dontPushtrue if this groupItem shouldn’t push away on creation; default is false
dontPushtrue if this groupItem shouldn’t push away or snap on creation; default is false
immediatelytrue if we want all placement immediately, not with animation

Variables

_activeTab

this._activeTab

The TabItem for the groupItem’s active tab.

defaultName

The prompt text for the title field.

Functions

setActiveTab

setActiveTab: function GroupItem_setActiveTab(tab)

Sets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.

getActiveTab

getActiveTab: function GroupItem_getActiveTab()

Gets the active TabItem for this groupItem; can be null, but only if there are no children.

getStorageData

getStorageData: function GroupItem_getStorageData()

Returns all of the info worth storing about this groupItem.

isEmpty

isEmpty: function GroupItem_isEmpty()

Returns true if the tab groupItem is empty and unnamed.

save

save: function GroupItem_save()

Saves this groupItem to persistent storage.

deleteData

deleteData: function GroupItem_deleteData()

Deletes the groupItem in the persistent storage.

getTitle

getTitle: function GroupItem_getTitle()

Returns the title of this groupItem as a string.

setTitle

setTitle: function GroupItem_setTitle(value)

Sets the title of this groupItem with the given string

adjustTitleSize

adjustTitleSize: function GroupItem_adjustTitleSize()

Used to adjust the width of the title box depending on groupItem width and title size.

getContentBounds

getContentBounds: function GroupItem_getContentBounds()

Returns a <Rect> for the groupItem’s content area (which doesn’t include the title, etc).

setBounds

setBounds: function GroupItem_setBounds(rect,
immediately,
options)

Sets the bounds with the given <Rect>, animating unless “immediately” is false.

Parameters

recta <Rect> giving the new bounds
immediatelytrue if it should not animate; default false
optionsan object with additional parameters, see below

Possible options

forcetrue to always update the DOM even if the bounds haven’t changed; default false

setZ

setZ: function GroupItem_setZ(value)

Set the Z order for the groupItem’s container, as well as its children.

close

close: function GroupItem_close()

Closes the groupItem, removing (but not closing) all of its children.

closeAll

closeAll: function GroupItem_closeAll()

Closes the groupItem and all of its children.

_unhide

_unhide: function GroupItem__unhide()

Shows the hidden group.

closeHidden

closeHidden: function GroupItem_closeHidden()

Removes the group item, its children and its container.

_fadeAwayUndoButton

_fadeAwayUndoButton: function GroupItem__fadeAwayUdoButton()

Fades away the undo button

_createUndoButton

_createUndoButton: function GroupItem__createUndoButton()

Makes the affordance for undo a close group action

add

add: function GroupItem_add(a,
options)

Adds an item to the groupItem.  Parameters:

aThe item to add.  Can be an Item, a DOM element or an iQ object.  The latter two must refer to the container of an Item.
optionsAn object with optional settings for this call.

Options

index(int) if set, add this tab at this index
immediately(bool) if true, no animation will be used
dontArrange(bool) if true, will not trigger an arrange on the group

remove

remove: function GroupItem_remove(a,
options)

Removes an item from the groupItem.  Parameters:

aThe item to remove.  Can be an Item, a DOM element or an iQ object.  The latter two must refer to the container of an Item.
optionsAn optional object with settings for this call.  See below.

Possible options

dontArrangedon’t rearrange the remaining items
dontClosedon’t close the group even if it normally would
immediatelydon’t animate

removeAll

removeAll: function GroupItem_removeAll(options)

Removes all of the groupItem’s children.  The optional “options” param is passed to each remove call.

hideExpandControl

hideExpandControl: function GroupItem_hideExpandControl()

Hide the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.

showExpandControl

showExpandControl: function GroupItem_showExpandControl()

Show the control which expands a stacked groupItem into a quick-look view.

shouldStack

shouldStack: function GroupItem_shouldStack(count)

Returns true if the groupItem should stack (instead of grid).

arrange

arrange: function GroupItem_arrange(options)

Lays out all of the children.

Parameters

optionspassed to Items.arrange or _stackArrange, except those below

Options

addTab(boolean) if true, we add one to the child count
oldDropIndexif set, we will only set any bounds if the dropIndex has changed
dropPos(<Point>) a position where a tab is currently positioned, above this group.
animate(boolean) if true, movement of children will be animated.

Returns

dropIndexan index value for where an item would be dropped, if options.dropPos is given.

_stackArrange

_stackArrange: function GroupItem__stackArrange(bb,
options)

Arranges the children in a stack.

Parameters

bb<Rect> to arrange within
optionssee below

Possible “options” properties

animatewhether to animate; default: true.

_randRotate

_randRotate: function GroupItem__randRotate(spread,
index)

Random rotation generator for _stackArrange

childHit

childHit: function GroupItem_childHit(child)

Called by one of the groupItem’s children when the child is clicked on.

Returns an object

shouldZoomtrue if the browser should launch into the tab represented by the child
callbackcalled after the zoom animation is complete

collapse

collapse: function GroupItem_collapse()

Collapses the groupItem from the expanded “tray” mode.

_addHandlers

_addHandlers: function GroupItem__addHandlers(container)

Helper routine for the constructor; adds various event handlers to the container.

setResizable

setResizable: function GroupItem_setResizable(value,
immediately)

Sets whether the groupItem is resizable and updates the UI accordingly.

newTab

newTab: function GroupItem_newTab(url)

Creates a new tab within this groupItem.

reorderTabItemsBasedOnTabOrder

reorderTabItemsBasedOnTabOrder: function GroupItem_reorderTabItemsBasedOnTabOrder()

Reorders the tabs in a groupItem based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the tab bar.  It does it by sorting the children of the groupItem by the positions of their respective tabs in the tab bar.

reorderTabsBasedOnTabItemOrder

reorderTabsBasedOnTabItemOrder: function GroupItem_reorderTabsBasedOnTabItemOrder()

Reorders the tabs in the tab bar based on the arrangment of the tabs shown in the groupItem.

setTopChild

setTopChild: function GroupItem_setTopChild(topChild)

Sets the Item that should be displayed on top when in stack mode.

getChild

getChild: function GroupItem_getChild(index)

Returns the nth child tab or null if index is out of range.

Parameters

indexthe index of the child tab to return, use negative numbers to index from the end (-1 is the last child)

getChildren

getChildren: function GroupItem_getChildren()

Returns all children.

GroupItems

Singelton for managing all GroupItems.

Functions

init

init: function GroupItems_init()

uninit

uninit : function GroupItems_uninit ()

pauseArrange

pauseArrange: function GroupItems_pauseArrange()

Bypass arrange() calls and collect for resolution in resumeArrange()

pushArrange

pushArrange: function GroupItems_pushArrange(groupItem,
options)

Push an arrange() call and its arguments onto an array to be resolved in resumeArrange()

resumeArrange

resumeArrange: function GroupItems_resumeArrange()

Resolve bypassed and collected arrange() calls

_handleAttrModified

_handleAttrModified: function GroupItems__handleAttrModified(xulTab)

watch for icon changes on app tabs

addAppTab

addAppTab: function GroupItems_addAppTab(xulTab)

Adds the given xul:tab to the app tab tray in all groups

removeAppTab

removeAppTab: function GroupItems_removeAppTab(xulTab)

Removes the given xul:tab from the app tab tray in all groups

getNextID

getNextID: function GroupItems_getNextID()

Returns the next unused groupItem ID.

getStorageData

getStorageData: function GroupItems_getStorageData()

Returns an object for saving GroupItems state to persistent storage.

saveAll

saveAll: function GroupItems_saveAll()

Saves GroupItems state, as well as the state of all of the groupItems.

_save

_save: function GroupItems__save()

Saves GroupItems state.

getBoundingBox

getBoundingBox: function GroupItems_getBoundingBox(els)

Given an array of DOM elements, returns a <Rect> with (roughly) the union of their locations.

reconstitute

reconstitute: function GroupItems_reconstitute(groupItemsData,
groupItemData)

Restores to stored state, creating groupItems as needed.  If no data, sets up blank slate (including “new tabs” groupItem).

load

load: function GroupItems_load()

Loads the storage data for groups.  Returns true if there was global group data.

groupItemStorageSanity

groupItemStorageSanity: function GroupItems_groupItemStorageSanity(
   groupItemData
)

Given persistent storage data for a groupItem, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.

register

register: function GroupItems_register(groupItem)

Adds the given GroupItem to the list of groupItems we’re tracking.

unregister

unregister: function GroupItems_unregister(groupItem)

Removes the given GroupItem from the list of groupItems we’re tracking.

groupItem

groupItem: function GroupItems_groupItem(a)

Given some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate groupItem.  Currently only supports groupItem ids.

removeAll

removeAll: function GroupItems_removeAll()

Removes all tabs from all groupItems (which automatically closes all unnamed groupItems).

newTab

newTab: function GroupItems_newTab(tabItem,
options)

Given a TabItem, files it in the appropriate groupItem.

getActiveGroupItem

getActiveGroupItem: function GroupItems_getActiveGroupItem()

Returns the active groupItem.  Active means its tabs are shown in the tab bar when not in the TabView interface.

setActiveGroupItem

setActiveGroupItem: function GroupItems_setActiveGroupItem(groupItem)

Sets the active groupItem, thereby showing only the relevant tabs and setting the groupItem which will receive new tabs.

Paramaters

groupItemthe active GroupItem or <null> if no groupItem is active (which means we have an orphaned tab selected)

getActiveOrphanTab

getActiveOrphanTab: function GroupItems_getActiveOrphanTab()

Returns the active orphan tab, in cases when there is no active groupItem.

setActiveOrphanTab

setActiveOrphanTab: function GroupItems_setActiveOrphanTab(tabItem)

In cases where an orphan tab (not in a groupItem) is active by itself, this function is called and the “active orphan tab” is set.

Paramaters

groupItemthe active TabItem or <null>

_updateTabBar

_updateTabBar: function GroupItems__updateTabBar()

Hides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active groupItem or currently active orphan tabItem

updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBar

updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBar: function GroupItems_updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBar(
   tabItem
)

Sets active TabItem and GroupItem, and updates tab bar appropriately.

getOrphanedTabs

getOrphanedTabs: function GroupItems_getOrphanedTabs()

Returns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a groupItem.

getNextGroupItemTab

getNextGroupItemTab: function GroupItems_getNextGroupItemTab(reverse)

Paramaters

reversethe boolean indicates the direction to look for the next groupItem.  Returns the <tabItem>.  If nothing is found, return null.

moveTabToGroupItem

moveTabToGroupItem : function GroupItems_moveTabToGroupItem (tab,
groupItemId)

Used for the right click menu in the tab strip; moves the given tab into the given group.  Does nothing if the tab is an app tab.  Paramaters: tab - the <xul:tab>. groupItemId - the groupItem’s id.  If nothing, create a new groupItem.

killNewTabGroup

killNewTabGroup: function GroupItems_killNewTabGroup()

Removes the New Tab Group, which is now defunct.  See bug 575851 and comments therein.

removeHiddenGroups

removeHiddenGroups: function GroupItems_removeHiddenGroups()

Removes all hidden groups’ data and its browser tabs.

enforceMinSize

enforceMinSize: function GroupItems_enforceMinSize(bounds)

Takes a <Rect> and modifies that <Rect> in case it is too small to be the bounds of a GroupItem.

Parameters

bounds(<Rect>) the target bounds of a GroupItem

getUnclosableGroupItemId

getUnclosableGroupItemId: function GroupItems_getUnclosableGroupItemId()

If there’s only one (non-hidden) group, and there are app tabs present, returns that group.  Return the GroupItem’s Id

updateGroupCloseButtons

updateGroupCloseButtons: function GroupItems_updateGroupCloseButtons()

Updates group close buttons.

function GroupItem(listOfEls,

The TabItem for the groupItem’s active tab.
An Item that represents a tab.

Returns an object for saving GroupItems state to persistent storage.

Saves GroupItems state, as well as the state of all of the groupItems.
_save: function GroupItems__save()
Saves GroupItems state.
getBoundingBox: function GroupItems_getBoundingBox(els)
Given an array of DOM elements, returns a Rect with (roughly) the union of their locations.
reconstitute: function GroupItems_reconstitute(groupItemsData,
groupItemData)
Restores to stored state, creating groupItems as needed.
load: function GroupItems_load()
Loads the storage data for groups.
groupItemStorageSanity: function GroupItems_groupItemStorageSanity(
   groupItemData
)
Given persistent storage data for a groupItem, returns true if it appears to not be damaged.
register: function GroupItems_register(groupItem)
Adds the given GroupItem to the list of groupItems we’re tracking.
unregister: function GroupItems_unregister(groupItem)
Removes the given GroupItem from the list of groupItems we’re tracking.
groupItem: function GroupItems_groupItem(a)
Given some sort of identifier, returns the appropriate groupItem.
removeAll: function GroupItems_removeAll()
Removes all tabs from all groupItems (which automatically closes all unnamed groupItems).
newTab: function GroupItems_newTab(tabItem,
options)
Given a TabItem, files it in the appropriate groupItem.
getActiveGroupItem: function GroupItems_getActiveGroupItem()
Returns the active groupItem.
setActiveGroupItem: function GroupItems_setActiveGroupItem(groupItem)
Sets the active groupItem, thereby showing only the relevant tabs and setting the groupItem which will receive new tabs.
getActiveOrphanTab: function GroupItems_getActiveOrphanTab()
Returns the active orphan tab, in cases when there is no active groupItem.
setActiveOrphanTab: function GroupItems_setActiveOrphanTab(tabItem)
In cases where an orphan tab (not in a groupItem) is active by itself, this function is called and the “active orphan tab” is set.
_updateTabBar: function GroupItems__updateTabBar()
Hides and shows tabs in the tab bar based on the active groupItem or currently active orphan tabItem
updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBar: function GroupItems_updateActiveGroupItemAndTabBar(
   tabItem
)
Sets active TabItem and GroupItem, and updates tab bar appropriately.
getOrphanedTabs: function GroupItems_getOrphanedTabs()
Returns an array of all tabs that aren’t in a groupItem.
getNextGroupItemTab: function GroupItems_getNextGroupItemTab(reverse)
moveTabToGroupItem : function GroupItems_moveTabToGroupItem (tab,
groupItemId)
Used for the right click menu in the tab strip; moves the given tab into the given group.
killNewTabGroup: function GroupItems_killNewTabGroup()
Removes the New Tab Group, which is now defunct.
removeHiddenGroups: function GroupItems_removeHiddenGroups()
Removes all hidden groups’ data and its browser tabs.
enforceMinSize: function GroupItems_enforceMinSize(bounds)
Takes a Rect and modifies that Rect in case it is too small to be the bounds of a GroupItem.
getUnclosableGroupItemId: function GroupItems_getUnclosableGroupItemId()
If there’s only one (non-hidden) group, and there are app tabs present, returns that group.
updateGroupCloseButtons: function GroupItems_updateGroupCloseButtons()
Updates group close buttons.
this.locked
Affects whether an item can be pushed, closed, renamed, etc
this.userSize
A Point that describes the last size specifically chosen by the user.
arrange: function Items_arrange(items,
bounds,
options)
Arranges the given items in a grid within the given bounds, maximizing item size but maintaining standard tab aspect ratio for each
